title: Quiz 3: The Disaster Management Cycle
description: Assess your understanding of the Disaster Management Cycle, including Mitigation, Preparedness, Response, and Recovery.

questions.question: Arrange the phases of the Disaster Management Cycle in logical order (though they may overlap):
questions.explanation: The standard cycle flows: Mitigation -> Preparedness -> Response -> Recovery.

questions.question: Match the Disaster Management Phase with its correct definition:

pairs.right: Measures to minimize results from a disaster (e.g. building codes)
Planning how to respond (e.g. training, warning systems)
Initial actions taken as the event takes place

questions.explanation: Mitigation=Prevention/Reduction; Preparedness=Planning; Response=Action during event; Recovery=Restoration.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of 'Mitigation'?
questions.explanation: Building codes and zoning are long-term measures to minimize disaster results (Mitigation).
questions.hint: Which action happens long before a disaster to prevent damage?

questions.question: Which of the following activities belong to the 'Preparedness' phase? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Exercises, planning, and warning systems are preparedness. Evacuation is Response. Rebuilding is Recovery.
questions.hint: Select activities that happen BEFORE the disaster strikes.

questions.question: The ___BLANK___ phase involves returning the community to normal, where ideally the affected area is put in a condition equal to or better than before.
questions.explanation: Recovery involves returning the community to normal, including temporary housing and medical care.

questions.question: Disaster management phases are strictly separate and one must fully complete before the next begins.
questions.explanation: Disaster management is a cyclical process. Phases often overlap; the end of one is the beginning of another.
questions.hint: Can response and recovery happen at the same time?

questions.question: Review the diagram description: 'Initial actions taken as the event takes place. Involves evacuation, search and rescue.' Which phase is this?

richContent.content:
Phase X
Minimizing hazards created by disaster

questions.explanation: Response covers the initial actions during the event like SAR and evacuation.

questions.question: Which phase aims to reduce the harmful effects of a disaster and limit their impact on human suffering and economic assets?
questions.explanation: Mitigation involves recognizing disasters will occur and attempting to reduce/limit their harmful effects permanently.

questions.question: What is the term for the phase that occurs as improvements are made in anticipation of an event, including planning and training?
questions.explanation: Preparedness occurs in anticipation of an event.

questions.question: Ideally, the Recovery phase should result in which of the following? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Conditions equal to or better than before the disaster

questions.explanation: Recovery aims to return to normal or 'build back better'.
questions.hint: Think about the long-term goal after a disaster.
